definitions.definition: To form into the shape of a cup, particularly of the hands.
examples: Cup your hands and I'll pour some rice into them.

definitions.definition: To hold something in cupped hands.
examples: He cupped the ball carefully in his hands.

definitions.definition: To pour (a liquid, drink, etc.) into a cup.
examples: We are cupping some new brands of coffee today.

definitions.definition: To supply with cups of wine .
To apply a cup or cupping apparatus to; to subject to the operation of cupping .
To make concave or in the form of a cup.
examples: to cup the end of a screw

main_definition: ( transitive ) To form into the shape of a cup, particularly of the hands.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To hold something in cupped hands.
( transitive ) To pour (a liquid, drink, etc.) into a cup.
( transitive , obsolete ) To supply with cups of wine .
( transitive , surgery , archaic ) To apply a cup or cupping apparatus to; to subject to the operation of cupping .
( transitive , engineering ) To make concave or in the form of a cup.
